root_cause_verification.rationale: Root cause was: 1) test/ naming conflicts with Python standard (tests/), 2) Manual test creation without git history validation, 3) Folders named test/ ignored by /clean. Solution correctly addresses all three: renamed to tests/ (Python standard), added git history analysis (analyze-git-edge-cases.sh), added migration script (migrate-test-to-tests.sh), added cleanup based on git edge cases (cleanup-tests-folder.sh). Commands/test.md Steps 2-4 implement the new workflow. Despite script bugs, the architectural approach is sound and directly addresses root cause from commit 296634bf.

issues.finding: Regex escaping bug - KEYWORDS array includes 'fix(' and 'bug(' causing grep to fail with 'Unmatched (' error
issues.recommendation: Remove parentheses from keywords or escape them. Change 'fix(' to 'fix\\(' or simply remove these patterns and keep 'fix:' and 'bug:' only. Line 54: PATTERN should escape special regex chars or use -F for fixed strings.

issues.finding: Script completes with exit 0 even when grep fails, masking the regex error
issues.recommendation: Consider checking grep exit code separately or using 'set -o pipefail' to detect pipeline failures (though '|| true' intentionally allows 0 results)

issues.finding: Syntax error - bash -n reports 'syntax error near unexpected token `2'' on line 80
issues.recommendation: Remove '2>/dev/null' from for loop glob pattern. Move error suppression inside loop or use different approach. Correct syntax: 'for validator in "$TESTS_DIR/scripts"/validate-*.py "$TESTS_DIR/scripts"/validate-*.sh; do' then check [[ -e "$validator" ]] to skip non-existent globs.
